result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn Michael Francour was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court urges DOC to get def into substance abuse program as soon as allowed

superMiscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.

Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.
No contact with E.W without prior approval by agent

Remit fines and costs
Def must submit DNA sample on 7-14-16
Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent, including, but not limited to; AODA, anger managment, parenting, and domestic violence

Defendant Shawn Michael Francour in court with attorney Bradley J. Schraven.  Defendant Shawn Michael Francour in custody.  Allen R Brey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:26pm
DA spks on sentencing
Atty Schraven spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
Court imposes:
18 months initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision. Court makes def eligible for SAP. Not eligible for CIP. 123 days credit. Court urges DOC to get def into substance abuse program as soon as allowed.
Conditions of ES:
Remit fines and costs
No contact with E.W without prior approval by agent
Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.  
Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent- including, but not limited to; AODA, anger management, parenting, and domestic violence
Def must submit DNA sample today
